title: Frequently Asked Questions about Akira Docs
description: A collection of frequently asked questions to help users troubleshoot common issues and understand the functionality of Akira Docs.
author: Akira Docs Team

blocks.content: Welcome to the FAQ section of Akira Docs! Here, you'll find answers to common questions and troubleshooting tips to enhance your experience.
1. What are the prerequisites for using Akira Docs?
Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed on your machine: Node.js (version 14 or later), npm or Yarn, and a basic understanding of command line usage.
2. How do I install Akira Docs?
To install Akira Docs, clone the repository and run npm install to install the required dependencies.
3. What should I do if I encounter an error during installation?
If you encounter an error, check your Node.js version and ensure all dependencies are correctly installed. You can also refer to the GitHub issues page for similar problems.
4. How can I create a new documentation page?
To create a new documentation page, simply create a new Markdown file in the docs directory and add your content.
5. Where can I find more resources or support?
For more resources, visit our official documentation site or check out our community forums for support.
6. Can I contribute to Akira Docs?
Absolutely! We welcome contributions from the community. Please check our contribution guidelines on GitHub.
If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to our support team!
